Call for Papers: 

Workshop on Exploring Programmer Tests 
XP/Agile Univers=
e 2003 

http://www.XProgramming.com/xpuPTsWorkshop2003/ 

J. B. Rainsberge=
r, Diaspar Software Services 
Ron Jeffries, www.XProgramming.com 
Rick Mugr=
idge, University of Auckland 

Enthusiasts and practitioners of test-orient=
ed programming are invited to participate in this workshop to explore issue=
s related to Programmer tests. Participants will share their experiences an=
d learn through multiple group discussions on the topics that interest them=
 most. We aim to advance the art of writing programmer tests through this p=
rocess. 

We will focus on Programmer Tests as defined in Test-Driven Devel=
opment and the XP literature. Such tests are written by programmers to driv=
e the development of software, demonstrate step-by-step progress towards th=
e completion of a task and provide a safety net for refactoring. 

We will =
explore specific strategies and techniques that participants can apply in t=
heir work, in addition to considering the "big picture" of testing. 

Submi=
ssions due: 10 July 2003 

For further details see: http://www.XProgramming=
.com/xpuPTsWorkshop2003/ 

Please contact jbr@... if you ha=
ve any questions. 

J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services=
